comment: COMMENT: This file contains all the tutorial text from the game's map (level) files.

name: <N>This is your main character, $MCG.<N>She can't move.
<N>Enemies come from here.<N>Don't let them reach $MCG!
<N>In New Game+ mode, the enemies are much stronger, and have new abilities.
<N>For instance, all normal revenant now regenerate health.
<N>Click here to select the BERSERKER menu.
<N>Right now you only have your berserkers. When you meet the next hero in the story, you'll unlock all the characters of that class.
What did you do to me??
I don't know! There are monsters after me! Help!
Why am I transparent? Where's my body?
<N>This shows all the BERSERKERS in your party.<N>Right now you only have this guy.
<N>Your old characters have all the strength, skills, and equipment from the last game.
I called out... and I felt you in my mind...
Don't slip away! I have to concentrate!
If I focus- maybe I can bring you here!
I really shouldn't have eaten that lizard stew....
<N>Click where you want to place your defender.<N><N>This is a good spot!
<N>$MCG uses Psi energy to summon defenders.<N>Killing enemies recharges your Psi.
What's that, you say?<N>Impress you with feats of manly violence?
Come on, you drooling wretches!<N>Your evisceration awaits!
This is great and all, but I can't help feeling like I should be more awesome than this.
You sure you got ALL of my body? Nothing's....missing?
I think if I can channel more energy towards you...
<N>This is $BER's BOOST BAR.<N> BOOSTING $BER will make him stronger and faster.
<N>At BOOST level 2,<N>$BER can use his second technique, DOUBLE HIT.
I'm back in that strange place... that half-way place...
Bring me in! I feel like I'm floating in space!
<N>Remember,<N>click here to select the BERSERKER menu.
<N>These buttons tell $BER which enemy to attack.
<N>Remember, use these buttons<N>to speed up or slow down time.
<N>You can do stuff even when time is PAUSED.<N>Use <PAUSE> to quickly toggle pause.
<N>Don't forget to BOOST $BER.<N>It's an essential tactic.
<N>OH NO!<N>$BER can't reach this next wave of enemies!
<N>Nice!<N>Use lightning to get enemies that slip by.
<N>Use it sparingly, though.<N>It costs PSI to use.
What the- What are you doing?
I feel like... when I had the plague...
When I thought I was dying...
Well, instead of dying, let's kick some butt!
I find it preferable to death, generally.
$MCG can now select between two classes by choosing the Berserker or Ranger tabs.
<N>Mouse over the waves above to get more details.
<N>For instance, these RED enemies can fight back!
<N>Also, note this symbol. That's where this wave will spawn.
If you've hired more berserkers,<N>$MCG can summon them to the Half-Way World by selecting the BERSERKER menu.
$BER is still your best fighter -<N>boost him to use his Double Hit" attack"
These undead rangers have a long range attack - plan accordingly!
<N>You can recall defenders from battle to<N>regain some PSI and place them elsewhere.
<N>To do this, select a defender and click <LQ>recall,<RQ> or press <RECALL>.
<N>Before the first enemy wave arrives,<N>recalling returns 100% of your PSI.
The hospital lies just across that river...
I can feel them...they KNOW I'm here.
Relax, $MCG! We can hide on the far side of the river!
And by <LQ>hide<RQ> I mean <LQ>murder<RQ> and by <LQ>far side of the river<RQ> I mean...
Wait...is it just me, or does it look like those things can swim?
More like a doggie paddle.  Your style sucks!
You hear that?  I just called you doggies!
Have you ever noticed that every time you open your mouth, stupid comes out?
Ice mages can slow down attackers, which is very useful on short paths and fast enemies.
Now my heart sings the battle-song.
We shall see the frost serve the Fire...
And our enemies drown in their own blood.
These new revenant have armor that deflects much of the damage dealt to them.
Hey wimps!  Real men fight shirtless!
Hey, if they want to bundle up, let 'em.
The less zombified...jangly bits I have to stare at, the better.
I know I'm super awesome and everything, but how am I supposed to fight guys totally encased in armor?
$MCG, strike one of those crystals with lightning as the enemy passes it!
The knight has an armor break skill that weakens armor with each hit.
I can smash the armor right off these fiends!
$BER, what on earth are you doing?!
This is how real men fight!
Put your pants back on right now.
Do it now or I won't pull you in with the rest of us.
How can I hit these guys when I can't see them?!
They seem to be producing some kind of cloud around themselves.
How can we fend them off then?
I think I can dispel this darkness...but only for a moment.
These strange cultists have become terrifyingly powerful revenant.  Slow but deadly, they will only be defeated by the combined efforts of many defenders.
What on earth is that thing?
It looks like it's about to pop!
Yeah, it's like that time I ate all that fermented mushroom gulash...
Except these spew baby revenant everywhere instead of-
Are there any other unusually sized body parts fixing to burst out of the ground?
Come over here so I can kill you!
These foolish blooded ones believe the battle over...
But that destroyed creature of flesh and spirit is not what they believe it to be.
Filled with the zeal of the Master...I AM THE RIGHT HAND OF EZTLI-TENOCH
Zelemir?! What are you doing here?
I will not lie idly by and watch the monster I have fought for so long escape.
You murderer! You think that we will-
This is not the time! Either we kill him or all is lost!
After that, you may take your vengeance.
It's no use! His magic is protecting him!
Lady, we are here with you...
Until now, you have been lending your power to others.
But now we lend ours to you.
<N>For the first time,<N>$MCG herself can be boosted!
Lady, our prayers are with you!
The power of all of us...
Shall I speak to the dog in its own tongue?
The rabble that begged me to be their god now shakes their fists at heaven, poisoning the air with empty threats.
In what world can YOU face ME?
You are one great being, spread over many.
But many are united in me.
We all strike you down as one.
You may be able to come half-way with feeble steps...
...but only I can walk the paths of the spirit.
He has gone all the way... into the other side...
We cannot reach him from this half-way world.
$MCG, you are like me... you can call others into this half-way world...
But with all these people here... lending us their power...
With all our combined power I can enter the other world completely...
And there I will kill the wretched wizard!
You cannot do this alone, brother.
I will pay the price alone.
Rabble of fools! You think a dog can-
Shall I speak to the dog in its own tongue?
The rabble that begged me to be their god now shakes their fists at heaven, poisoning the air with empty threats.
In what world can YOU face ME?
You are one great being, spread over many.
But many are united in me.
We all strike you down as one.
You may be able to come half-way with feeble steps...
...but only I can walk the paths of the spirit.
He has gone all the way... into the other side...
We cannot reach him from this half-way world.
$MCG, I am dying... but with what strength I have...
You are like me... you can call others into this half-way world...
But with all these people here... lending us their power...
I can feel it... together... we...
With all our combined power I can enter the other world completely...
With my dying strength... I will kill the wizard.
One lone, dying man, against a god?
Brother, you cannot do this alone.
Let us finish this as we began it.
It is good... to have you back, old friend...
Shall I speak to the dog in its own tongue?
The rabble that begged me to be their god now shakes their fists at heaven, poisoning the air with empty threats.
In what world can YOU face ME?
You are one great being, spread over many.
But many are united in me.
We all strike you down as one.
You may be able to come half-way with feeble steps...
...but only I can walk the paths of the spirit.
He has gone all the way... into the other side...
We cannot reach him from this half-way world.
What have you become, my Tletl-Meztli?
Together we rose above the tide of filth.
We defended ourselves from the pettiness of mortality.
We tore down the lowness of men and raised them to glory!
Have you spent so long lost in the world of men that you forget you are a god?
We carry within us the terrible obligations of divinity!
Shall we let the aspersions of the rabble corrupt our calling?
Our eyes have gazed upon the secrets of spirit and you would now willingly blind yourself?
I cannot follow you in this path of self destruction.
Shall I cast you aside like this vessel of meager flesh? Are you nothing more?
We became what we needed to be! What we had to be! We cannot go back!
How can you harden your heart against me? How can you force me to destroy what I love?
You cast aside all that we are? All that we have created?
...So I must purge the last trappings of mortality.
Sorry, it's hard to concentrate when you get hit so much!
Just hurry up and pull me back in! I'm missing out on killing stuff!
Yo $MCG! One of my buddies is down! Pull him back in! We got murderin' to do!
Hold still. I'll get you back in a second.
Hurry up, this feels really weird!
Hey! We're losing people over here! Get 'em back in!
HAHAHA! I AM THE SEXY GOD OF VIOLENCE!
LOOK ON MY RIPPLING ABS, YE MIGHTY, AND DESPAIR!
<N>Click on that defender to upgrade skills.
This is the defender's SKILL TREE.
<N>The ROUND skills are TECHNIQUES<N>actively used in battle.
<N>The SQUARE skills are passive TRAITS,<N>always-on abilities.
<N>Mousing over the skill shows what will happen when you upgrade it.
<N>Click on the skill to increase it by 1 point.
<N>This is $MCG's SKILL TREE.<N>$MCG's skills are all SPELLS.
<N>$MCG has one SKILL POINT to spend.<N>Mouse over to view the LIGHTNING spell
<N>Mousing over shows what will happen when you upgrade this skill.
<N>Click the orb to increase this skill by 1 point.
<N>You can purchase equipment and hire new defenders in towns.
You should hire BERSERKERS and buy WEAPONS now.<N><N>(Note: each hire gets more expensive.)
These are the weapons for sale.<N>Click on a weapon type to make the 'BUY' button appear.
<N>Different towns have different things to offer.
<N>For instance, you can hire RANGERS and purchase ARMOR in this town.
<N>Remember, bigger armies are more expensive - each new hire costs more than the last.
Lost and alone, $MCG finds herself caught between life and death.
$MCG stumbles across a merchant caravan brimming with goods.
Our heroes are forced to fight revenant in Ozimal's coliseum.
Ozimal's prison town of slaves and gladiators. A mix of deplorable scum and innocent bystanders, all eager to escape.
The prison is empty - someone blew a hole in the wall and all the prisoners escaped.
Ozimal demonstrates $MCG's talents for a strange guest...
A bold escape from the coliseum takes the party over a river.
A dilapidated shanty town - looks like the escaped prisoners took refuge here.
While on the run from Ozimal, $MCG returns to save those still trapped in the catacombs below the prison.
A survivor's camp of nomadic villagers. Karsk pays a heavy tribute to Ozimal to escape raids.
All that remains of Karsk is a thick layer of char. The bodies of the dead are nowhere to be found.
Ozimal's forces lay seige to Karsk.
Victims of the attack on Karsk rise again as long-ranged enemies.
A massive battle breaks out at the monastery gates.
A survivor's camp at the foot of a mountain, a frequent target of  Ozimal's raiding parties.
Enemies make an assault up the daunting monastery stairs.
A Selini Chapter House, a monastery of the Ash kingdom's primary religion.
$MCG purges the revenant infestation in the river so that it can once again be used for fishing
$MCG rushes to defend the hospital from a surprise attack.
The party helps defend the besieged hospital.
A Seleni House of Mercy, a place of refuge and healing for the wounded and sick.
$RAN begrudgingly keeps a promise to another member of the Geka tribe.
While $MCG and $RAN are gone, $BER and $HEA are spirited away by a mysterious woman.
Trailed by a band of revenant, the party makes a stand before entering the Desert Stronghold.
Seeking refuge in the stronghold, the party finds something sinister in the darkness.
A lone knight joins the party and shows off his armor-busting skills.
A fort inhabited by former guards of the pit, hiding from vengeful plague survivors.
The mysterious woman returns, abducting $BER and $KNI.
$KNI leads the party deeper into the stronghold in search of answers.
The party finds an unlikely ally deep in the catacombs.
$DRA agrees to help if the heroes help defend her nest.
$DRA's nesting grounds, stocked with treasure and home to her young.
$DRA is hungry. $MCG offers an alternative to human flesh.
The party fights their way into an ancient archive chamber, hoping for answers.
This is a Quaid Fire Shrine
$MAG and $MCG purify a defiled Quaid Fire Shrine
The remnants of the ranger's town.  A few rangers remain amongst the rubble.
The party escapes the Citadel through a sewer tunnel, pursued by a force of revenant.
$HEA plans to detonate the mines, if $MCG can hold off the revenant army long enough.
Zelemir stands between the party and the way out.
A nearly abandoned village, populated by a few roaming mercenaries and Quaid survivors.
Making their way to the east side of the Pit, the party crosses into Eztli-Tenoch's domain.
The party finds themselves in the ancient ruins of a strange city.  What is this place?
The former throne room of Eztli-Tenoch himself, now the site of a new battle.
$DRA's discovery is both a safe haven and a restocking location...if you've got the cash.
The mysterious woman's identity is finally revealed.
Dashing towards the mountain pass, the party is forced to fight across a river.
$MCG decides Zelemir's plan is too terrible and sets out after him.
$MCG accepts Zelemir's offer and sets out to escape from the Pit.
After fighting through the rear guard, $MCG's army must challenge Zelemir's.
$MCG rushes to stop Zelemir from igniting the crystals and destroying the Pit entirely.
An eccentric hermit from one of the nomad tribes lives here.
The residence of another hermit, strangely similar to the first.
A third hermit makes his abode deep in the fortress.
The last hermit makes his home in the desert.
There's a strange monument in the desert
